dialogues.text: Where's that sun tan lotion? Without opening her eyes, she reaches for the lotion. If she keeps feeling around, she's going to notice that she is floating in thin air.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL 194
dialogues.text: grabs the lotion and puts it into her hand. He continues photographing the women.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE 195
dialogues.text: as the blanket returns to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL 196
dialogues.text: Photographing them with the video camera.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH CAMERA
dialogues.text: Now we can see little sparks of electricity jumping between their bodies -- evidence of the power that is emerging from them.  198 199 200 201 202 203 204 205 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of Daryl, the women and the kids but mainly focusing on the faces of the women. PULL BACK to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wall of fifty-six video screens on which all these images are playing at once.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL 200
dialogues.text: Looking at the screens, playing with the controls until the screens are filled with the faces of the three women.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL'S BED
dialogues.text: Asleep in the bed. Tiny sparks of electricity seem to be dancing off their bodies. Little lines of current connecting them as if their bodies were surrounded by a field of power emanating from them.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL 202
dialogues.text: At the bed now, watching the women. A kind of sadness seems to come over him; a kind of longing for a beauty that he will never totally possess. Gently, lovingly he runs his hand lightly over their bodies. Then he begins kissing them. As he does this, he seems to absorb the power from the women into his own body. SUPERIMPOSE:

dialogues.speaker: SHOTS OF EASTWICK
dialogues.text: As this same "power" rips through the town. TELEPHONE WIRES CRACKLE and SNAP, GAS LINES EXPLODE out of the street, WATER MAINS CRACK forcing the sidewalks to buckle, etc. INTERCUT WITH the above, Daryl kissing each of the women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he slips into bed with the three women... cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: EASTWICK 205
dialogues.text: As all the lights in the town flicker and black out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound of a HYMN being sung by a CONGREGATION as we see the damage done by Daryl. LEGEND ON THE SCREEN: “MALEFICIO"

dialogues.speaker: MEN
dialogues.text: Working to repair the telephone lines.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Where the paving was ripped open, now surrounded with barricades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The congregation is singing the hymn.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: Who stops singing. She stands up, using crutches.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: Whores. Clyde is sitting next to her. He tugs at her sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Felicia? What is it? Sit down, Felicia. Felicia?

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: (louder) Whores! 206 207 208 209 210 Gradually everyone stops singing. They all look at Felici

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: (continuing) There is evil in the world. Clyde sinks.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: (continuing) And there is evil in this town. Look around you. You see what is happening.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Felicia, please... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: In our town, in our very homes. Clyde gets up and starts to lead Felicia out of the church. She still has a cast on her foot.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN 211
dialogues.text: In the church starts to laugh uncontrollably. Her hus- band tries to subdue her.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: You know who I'm talking about. You know what's going on in that house. Perversions. Vice. Shamelessness. Cavorting with that devil.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: She's all right. She's a little upset.

dialogues.speaker: SEVERAL OTHER WOMEN 213
dialogues.text: start to do strange things -- cry, twitch, gasp for breath, mutter, etc.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: Drugs will be next. Murder. Incest. Rape. Spanish flies. Dildos. Anal intercourse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: come out of the church.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: (sadly) Come on, Felicia. Let's go home.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: You employ one of them, Clyde.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Felicia, it's nobody's business... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: Chaos. Anarchy. Destruction. That's everybody's business.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: I'll get the car...

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: Once there was paradise. And then a serpent came into the garden.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Oh, for Christ's sake, Felicia. Stop this...

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: I have nothing against a good fuck, Clyde. But there is danger here. And somebody has to do something about it.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Yes, Felicia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where a tape is running on which Lamaze method of child- birth is demonstrated.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL AND FIDEL 217
dialogues.text: On the floor following the instructions of the video- tape. Fidel is playing the woman's part -- lying on the floor, knees bent, trying to breathe rhythmically. Daryl is kneeling over him. He has a book on the method in his hand. He is trying to follow both the tape and the book.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: That's good. That's great. Like that. That's it. Now what do I do? Oh. Here. Right. I count. Okay. Ready? Go. One... two... three... breathe... five... six... Are you breathing? I can't see you breathing. I can't count if you don't breathe. This isn't easy, you know. I mean, shit, all you have to do is breathe. I'm doing all the work here. Come on. Ready? And, boom -- one... two...  218 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is having breakfast with her daughter. She is still dressed like a workman -- overalls, sweatshirt, boots, goggles hanging around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That's the bus, honey.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Okay. Alex stops suddenly. She feels dizzy. She takes a deep breath and touches her stomach. Then she recovers.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: (continuing) What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I don't know. I just felt... Oh, honey, don't shovel your food down like that, you'll make yourself sick. They continue eating. Then...

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Mom, what's a dyke?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: A what? What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: A dyke. What's a dyke?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Where did you hear that? That word.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Margaret Elliot. She heard her mother talking to Felicia Gabriel. She said they were talking about you.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: All right, let's just calm down a minute.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: I am calm. Alex sits down next to Carol. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You know that I love you. Don't you, honey?

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Ever since your father died, I have tried to do everything I can to... Oh, Jesus. I want so much for you, Carol. I want you to have everything you want and I want you to be happy. I want to give you everything you need. And most of all I want to give you the truth. But I can't give you the truth unless I know it first. And that's what I'm doing now. I am looking for the truth. About myself and about lots of other things, too. No matter what you hear, no matter what your friends say about me -- that's what I'm doing. I am looking for the truth. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Yeah. But what's a dyke?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: A dyke is a wall they build to prevent floods. In Holland. It's like a dam. The school BUS HORN BLOWS outside.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (continuing) There's the bus. You better go.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Okay. Carol grabs her coat and books and goes. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a booth. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Two more this morning. That's twelve. Twelve cancellations. I'm not going to have anybody left to teach. A waitress brings them coffee.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Oh, Jane. It's terrible. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: What am I going to do? It's my only income. I'm already living on crackers and cat food. I'm so mad I could spit.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I think the word is out.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: About us and Daryl, you mean. Don't you?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Jealousy. They're just jealous. I would die in this awful place without Daryl. He's the only ray of light in this black hole. He is water in the desert. He's helping me write some pieces for cello and piano now. He says I should try a concerto.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: He is amazing, isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Yes. He's even got Sukie working on a novel.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Jane, you're not in love with him. Are you?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: No. I don't think so. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No. Me either. It's funny. I don't even feel close to him. I feel closer to you and Sukie. Closer than I did before. Somehow that makes it okay. Because we're friends and because I love you both. But I don't know what I feel about him.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I love him in a way, I guess. For everything he's doing for us...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: But why is he doing all this do you think?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: He's challenging us. He's stretching us.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yes, but what's in it for him?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Well, us, I guess. I mean...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I know. But aside from that...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I don't know, Alex. I can't think now. I'm too upset. And I don't feel well either. My whole system is going crazy.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I think we're all just a little confused. Everything is going to be all right. I know it is. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working hard now as they continue practicing the Lamaze method. Daryl is playing the woman's role now.  222 223 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying on Clyde's desk with a headline reading... "LENOX HOUSE SCANDALS." Over this, we hear...

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But how can you do this?!

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: We didn't mention any names. Except for this Van Horne fellow.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: But this is slander. This is libel. And it's also untrue.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: No, he did fill in the wetlands for that tennis court and he did alter the landmark building. And the town is filing a suit for two million dollars. It's all true.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: What about me, Clyde? I need this job. I have a family to support. And I'm improving, too. I started a novel. Really. I'd love you to take a look at it...

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: People are talking, Sukie. You and your friends. It's not good. And I don't own this newspaper, you know? And, well...

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Felicia. It's Felicia. Isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: She's a sick woman, Sukie. She's having a bad time. I don't know what to do. I want her to see a doctor. Not a doctor, but, you know, a ‘doctor.' But I'm afraid they might put her away. We went to high school together. She used to sing the 'Star Spangled Banner. ' Clyde takes a bottle of scotch from his desk and pours some into his coffee mug. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: (continuing) She used to wear those fuzzy sweaters and plaid skirts. Boyfriends. She was a real catch.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: She's unhappy. Isn't she?

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: And angry. Even before all these misfortunes. Before the accident. Angry. Why? Is it me? And hate. Why does she hate everything? Why does she hate me? Why do I hate her? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't know what happens between people.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. What am I doing?

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: You're firing me.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Yes, I am. She's right. I am weak. I'm a weak man. But I didn't make the world. This wasteland of disease and violence, she calls it. I didn't do that. Did I? And if I did, why didn't she stop me? That's what I want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is at her desk, gathering her things. She is aware of everyone watching her out of the corner of their eyes. But no one speaks to her or looks at her directly. Then she stops what she's doing. She feels funny. A little dizzy. She stretches her neck, rubs her eyes. She feels nauseous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On line at the checkout counter. She looks at...  226 227 228 229 230 231 74.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSPAPER HEADLINE 226
dialogues.text: Of The Word (the Eastwick newspaper).

dialogues.speaker: JANE 227
dialogues.text: Shocked as she grabs a copy from the rack and starts to read it.

dialogues.speaker: PEOPLE 228
dialogues.text: Around Jane, watching her, whispering and snickering.

dialogues.speaker: JANE 229
dialogues.text: Aware of being watched. She feels dizzy. She panics. She has to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (to the Cashier) Could you hurry, please. I don't feel so good.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: (with sarcasm) I'm not surprised. The CASHIER laughs. Jane is fighting tears and nausea. She turns to head for the exit. As she turns, she does not see...

dialogues.speaker: CASH REGISTER 230
dialogues.text: starts to go crazy, RINGING itself into a frenzy, spitting out receipts, opening its drawer and spewing money at the Cashier.

dialogues.speaker: JANE 231
dialogues.text: Unaware of whats happening with the cash register, she bumps into the PEOPLE in line.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Hey! Watch what you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Please... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Slut. Jane hurries away. Just as she goes...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S CART 232
dialogues.text: All the items in the shopping cart tremble. PACKAGES SNAP open. CANS EXPLODE spitting soups and vegetables over the Woman.

dialogues.speaker: JANE 233
dialogues.text: Heading for the exit. SHELVES COLLAPSE as she passes them -- Rows of FOOD ITEMS CRASH to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND NEFF 234
dialogues.text: Who sees Jane and freezes in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: JANE 235
dialogues.text: sees Raymond and turns to go the other way.

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND
dialogues.text: You stay away from me! Suddenly the bottoms fall out of his grocery bags. Before he can move, a phalanx of empty GROCERY CARTS move swiftly up behind him, CRASH into him and literally run over him.

dialogues.speaker: JANE 237
dialogues.text: Running out of the store, feeling ill and dizzy and only vaguely aware of the chaos in the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, Alex and Sukie are seated around the table. Daryl is serving them coffee. The women are very upset.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Maybe we should just stop seeing each other for a while. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You might be right.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Oh, let's not overreact here...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Everything is going crazy.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It's a small town, Daryl. You don't understand. Fidel brings a great bowl of cherries to the table. Daryl passes it around and they all start eating them.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: We're not doing anything wrong? Are we?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I lied to Carol today. I did. I've never lied to her before. Maybe it is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Felicia thinks it's wrong. Clyde says she has visions.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Why is it always women who have visions?

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: He says she sees the devil. Here in Eastwick.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Why would he bother? I mean, if you were the devil, would you come to Eastwick?

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know. Poor Felicia... He spits out a cherry pit.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Poor Felicia, poor Felicia. I'm sick of her.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Really. I wish she would just go away. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Come on. Don't let her get to you. Here. Have a cherry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: are sitting in front of the fire. Clyde is reading the newspaper and drinking heavily. Felicia is doing needlepoint.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: You're drunk.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Hmn?

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: I said you are drunk!

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Yes. I suppose I am.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: I'm trying to tell you that they are selling pornography at Schyler's News Shop. On the shelves. In the open. Children can see ‘ith'... She lisps the last word and gags silently. She tries to continue speaking but it's as if she has a marble in her mouth -- garbled.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: (continuing) ... They were standing there looking at this filth in broad daylight...

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: I can't understand a word you're saying.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: I 'thaid'... Her hand goes to her mouth, she spits something from her mouth into her hand. It is a cherry pit. Felicia looks at it. She gags again and two more pits come out of her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: (continuing) ... He's here, Clyde. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Hmn.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: He's here.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: who calmly goes back to her needlepoint.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: Yes... ‘'yeth'... He 'th' here... Another cherry pit appears on her lips. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floating in the pool.
239 240 241 242 Daryl, Jane, Alex and Sukie are all on individual rafts floating around the bowl of cherries. They continue eating cherries and tossing the pits and stems into the bowl.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: She made a scene today at Schyler's, grabbing magazines from kids and chasing them out of the store.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: She's all twisted. I think she's in pain. And Clyde, too. He started drinking.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Maybe we could help.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Maybe we could put them out of her misery.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Don't. That's terrible. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I don't care. All this hysterical moaning. What's the matter with them? Both of them. Two thousand years of civilization, you'd think two people could get it together by now. Christ, it's a biological necessity. Men and women. There's no way out of it. You'd think by now we'd know how to make it work. But no. Most people don't even know how to fuck anymore, let alone live together.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Oh, come on. Don't. I can't stand to see you upset like this. You don't know what it does to me.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You don't know what she's doing to us.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: But if she is in pain...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Oh, listen, she'll survive all of us. People like that live forever.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What a horrible thought.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: If there were just some way to shut her up... They drift into the thought. Daryl looks at them sadly. Then...

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Have another cherry. Jane bites into one and tosses the stem into the bowl.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: As she plucks a stem from her teeth. As much as she can, she continues working on her needlepoint, paying little attention to the things coming out of her mouth. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: He's trying to get inside me, Clyde. He's trying to use me. And these women. He's using them, too. He wants to get inside us and take our goodness.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Yes, Felicia.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: Just like a man. Like all men. We give them our goodness, and they destroy the earth with it.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: All right, Felicia. Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: Those poor women. I have to warn them, Clyde. Felicia calmly picks up the phone and the telephone book. Clyde gets up and goes to the fire. He pokes at the logs with a poker.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Felicia?

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: I know who he is, Clyde. I know... Suddenly a stream of cherry pits comes pouring out of her mouth. Finally, Clyde notices.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Felicia, what in hell...?

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: He will propagate, Clyde. He will increase his number. They will bear him sons. He will take their love and continue to destroy the earth...

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: What have you been eating?

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: You idiot. Weak, gutless, foul man! You, too, are one of his number. You, too, are a man. Another stream of cherry pits splatters from her mouth. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: (calmly) Felicia, I wish you would stop that.

dialogues.speaker: FELICIA
dialogues.text: I stand up to evil, Clyde. I am not afraid. Felicia rises, transported by her zeal, and starts to move toward Clyde. Unfortunately, another stream of cherry pits diminishes the stature of her move.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: Okay, Felicia. Come on. Let's call it a day. Felicia seems to growl and then spews forth a great foun- tain from her mouth of cherries, cherry pits and stems.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: (continuing) Let's just call it a day. And then, sort of haphazardly, as if he were just putting her back in her chair, he raises the poker and brings it down on her head. Felicia staggers back and does indeed sit back down in her chair. In fact, she is dead. Clyde looks at her for a moment. Then he sits down, sips his drink and goes back to reading his newspaper. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bowl is floating on the water. MUTED sounds of SPLASHING and LAUGHING are heard from above the surface of the water. And then the rippling water tips the bowl. We can see hands reach for the bowl. They catch it. But the cherry pits drift down TOWARD us, blotches of red cherry juice spreading through the water. The redness FILLS the SCREEN as we... cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several police cars, an ambulance and several unmarked cars are in the driveway and parked in front. Police and detectives are hanging around the property, drinking coffee and going in and out of the house casually. A small number of people are scattered in the street. Not a crowd, just a few curious and probably shocked neighbors, milling in groups of twos and threes.  246 247 248 82.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE 246
dialogues.text: farther down the street, away from the others. She stands next to her car, staring at the house.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX'S CAR 247
dialogues.text: driving slowly up the street and stopping near Sukie's car. Alex and Jane get out and go to Sukie.

dialogues.speaker: THREE OF THEM 248
dialogues.text: Sukie sees Alex and Jane coming toward her. She starts to cry. Alex puts her arms around Sukie.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Oh, baby. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: I've never known a man more gentle than Clyde. He just couldn't do this.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Come on. Don't.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: No. Don't you see?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Us. Last night. All that talk.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Sukie, those are just words. That's all. They're just words.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: No, they're not! They make things happen! We make things happen.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It doesn't have anything to do with us.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Yes it does! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Look, we're all upset now. Maybe we should talk to Daryl.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Why? Why do we have to do everything Daryl says? What's happening to us?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: She's right, Jane. For God's sake...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: All right, Alex, just don't start with me now, please!

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Can't we think for ourselves anymore? Some man comes along and nothing else matters?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I didn't say that. All TI said...

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Sure. Run to Daryl...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: If you're going to start being jealous...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Jealous?!

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: ... Just because he happens to spend more time with me...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: God, you really are dumb, Jane.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Alex, don't.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: You bastard.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Can't you stop thinking from between your legs for one minute?

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Alex, please... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Stop whining, Sukie! For Christ's sake!

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Leave her alone! All three start screaming at the same time...

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE ALEX
dialogues.text: You're the one who Try using your heads introduced me to him. for once, will you? Any You're the one who little thing happens and dragged me over there. the first thing you do I didn't want to go. I is get hysterical. I'm never wanted to go. I hate tired of it. I'm tired you. I hate you both! of both of you!

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (simultaneous with the above) You never really did like me, did you, Alex? Always just putting up with me. Always so superior. I don't need that. I don't need either one of you! The heat of the argument and the force of these last words creates a FAINT RUMBLE under the ground where they are standing. They look down at...

dialogues.speaker: PAVING 249
dialogues.text: of the street cracks -- a thin hairline crack that spreads swiftly in a line running between three women, separating each one from the other.

dialogues.speaker: HOUSE 250
dialogues.text: where there seems to be some activity stirring.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE GABRIEL 251
dialogues.text: being led from the house to one of the police cars. He seems calm. He looks around at the people standing on the street. Then he stops walking when he sees...

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE, ALEX AND JANE 252
dialogues.text: in the distance, watching.  253 254 255 256 257 258 259 85.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE 253
dialogues.text: who is not sure at first if it's really them. Then he is sure. He smiles at them. Then he raises his arm to- ward them as if to wave. But it also looks like he's pointing.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE 254
dialogues.text: as several people turn toward the women to see whom Clyde is gesturing toward. The police hustle Clyde into the car.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE AND ALEX AND JANE 255
dialogues.text: who don't know where to look. They look at each other. Sukie gets into her car and drives away. Jane turns away from Alex and walks down the street. Alex looks back at Clyde's house. Then she gets into her car and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking especially bleak against the gray sky. A fierce winter storm is gathering force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is sitting alone at the head of the table. The table is set for four. Daryl checks his watch. Fidel comes into the room. He places a telephone on the table next to Daryl.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: (sadly) Anybody call? No answer. Daryl picks up the phone and starts dialing. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The great stone sits in the yard covered with canvas. The storm rains hail and snow over it. CELLO MUSIC CONTINUES. A TELEPHONE STARTS to RING.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX 259
dialogues.text: Seen THROUGH the kitchen WINDOW. She is looking at the stone. Ice forms on the window, blocking her view. The PHONE keeps RINGING.  260 261 262 263 264 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is clearing sheets of her manuscript off her desk. She throws them into the fireplace to burn. CELLO MUSIC CONTINUES. PHONE is still RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is playing the cello. Tears are streaming from her eyes. Her TELEPHONE is also RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is still sitting at the table. He hangs up the phone. The candles have burned down to nothing. They flicker and are about to go out. Daryl sits there. He looks at the candles. He takes a deep breath and blows an icy breath across the table. The candles go out and everything on the table freezes -- covered suddenly by a glistening crystal layer of ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NEWS is ON. A picture of Clyde Gabriel is on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... Was indicted today for the brutal slaying of his wife, Felicia Gabriel, in the town of Eastwick. The accused remains in custody in Providence while his attorneys say they will change their plea from not guilty to innocent by reason of insanity...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX 264
dialogues.text: watching the TV, very upset. The TELEPHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... There was no comment from the accused, although reliable sources at the county jail reported that Mr. Gabriel was in ‘good spirits.' And on the weather front, no letup is in sight as temperatures continue to drop... She switches OFF the TV and picks up the phone. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: (on phone) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Daryl.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Yeah. Remember me? How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (phone) I'm fine, Daryl. What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Oh, nothing. I just called to see how you were doing. See how you were. See... you know, what was going on. Cutting back and forth:

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well, I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Well, good. That's great.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Well, I just wanted to be sure you were okay, make sure you didn't have any uncontrollable desire to see me. In case you were really missing me and were, you know, too embarrassed to call. I thought it might make it easier if I called first, then that way you could still feel superior and get to see me at the same time. What do you say? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (smiles) I don't feel superior. I feel terrible.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Well, I feel terrible, too. So if we both feel terrible, can't we do something about it? I mean, what's going on here? Nobody calls me, nobody comes to see me...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I think we need some time. We just need some time. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: No. It's not okay. I don't understand, Alex.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Somebody died, Daryl. Felicia died.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well, people die every day. What's that got to do with us?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (close to tears) Look. I can't talk now. I have to go. Good-bye. Daryl. Don't call here. Please. I have to go...

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Alex, don't hang up. Don't do this. Alex? Don't do this... She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is left holding the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens to reveal Jane's surprised face.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL 268
dialogues.text: Standing in the cold, bundled up against the storm.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Happy birthday. He hands her a long cylinder-shaped wrapped package.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: It's not my birthday.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: It's not. Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (smiles) Yes. I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, what the hell. Happy whatever day it is. Jane takes the package. She opens it. It's a funny- looking stuffed green snake.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: I'm freezing my nuts off out here.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I can't ask you in, Daryl. I'm sorry. I can't.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Just for a minute. Just to get warm. Have a cup of tea, make a little music... Come on. I know you girls are upset. Can't we just talk about it? Hmn? Jane is torn. Impulsively, she kisses him and then, on the verge of tears...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I can't. I'm sorry. Daryl. You have to go away. You have to go away now. She goes quickly inside and slams the door.  270 271 272 273 274 275 90.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL 270
dialogues.text: Whose expression turns from disappointment to anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sukie is in the doorway as her kids run off to meet the school bus. Sukie waves, then she sees...

dialogues.speaker: DARYL'S MERCEDES 272
dialogues.text: Parked across the road. Fidel gets out and approaches the house. He is carrying a basket of fruit.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE AND FIDEL 273
dialogues.text: As Fidel hands her a basket of fruit.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: What's this, Fidel? Fidel pushes the basket into her hands.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: (continuing) I can't accept this... Fidel gives her a card. She reads it. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: (continuing) .-. How is he! Fidel answers with a look that says, "Not too good."

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: (continuing) Tell him, I miss him, too. But the answer is no. No. Fidel goes. Sukie takes the basket of fruit and goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A replay of various happy scenes of Daryl and the women.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL 275
dialogues.text: Watching his "home movies" from the Jacuzzi. He pours himself a big drink. He is very drunk. Tears are in his eyes.  276 277 278 279 280 281 282 91.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE 276
dialogues.text: As the videos end. Fidel turns OFF the SCREENS with a remote unit.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: No. Play it again, Fidel. Play it again.

dialogues.speaker: SCREENS 277
dialogues.text: As a replay of the previous beach scene comes ON and we see Alex saying...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (on video) Getting old. Getting fat. That scares me. I mean, it's a short life, isn't it. I look in the mirror sometimes and I see everything falling apart. Fast...

dialogues.speaker: DARYL 278
dialogues.text: As an idea comes into his head. He smiles slightly through his tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is soaping herself in the bath. She seems very comfor- table. Then she drops the soap. Her hand feels stiff. She clenches and unclenches her fist. It feels okay now. She pulls the plug in the tub and turns ON the SHOWER. She stands under the shower and rinses herself off. Slowly, through the following, her body starts to age and grow fat. We do not see this all at once, but as follows...

dialogues.speaker: HER HAND 280
dialogues.text: reaching for a bottle of shampoo. Her fingers are thicker, fatter, older.

dialogues.speaker: HER HAIR 281
dialogues.text: being rinsed under the shower. The hair is streaked with gray.

dialogues.speaker: SOAPY WATER 282
dialogues.text: running over her feet. Her feet look older, slightly arthritic. Her legs are beginning to bloat.  283 284 285 286 287 92.

dialogues.speaker: SHOWER CURTAIN 283
dialogues.text: We hear the SHOWER being TURNED OFF. Then Alex's arm reaches for a towel. The arm looks thick, heavy.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM MIRROR 284
dialogues.text: Where Alex's head, covered by a towel, comes INTO VIEW. And then, Alex removes the towel. The sight is horrify- ing -- we are looking at an old, sick woman. The hair is white and sparse, the skin is blotched, hanging heavily off her cheeks and neck, the breasts are huge and sagging. Alex sees herself in the mirror. But be- fore she can react, the transformation continues at a faster rate. She touches her hair and pieces of it fall off and shed in her hands. The bones in her hands knot and protrude under the skin. The skin changes color. And then real disintegration begins -- as if she were a corpse and her body were rotting. Finally she screams. But the sound is inhuman. It is the sound of a corpse screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol comes out of her bedroom. She is half asleep. The SCREAMING STOPS. Silence. Carol walks slowly toward the bathroom door. She knocks on the door.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Mom? Mom, are you in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is on the floor, huddled in a corner of the room, trying to cover herself with the shower curtain which has been ripped off its hooks. But there is no need to cover herself. She is back to normal -- except for a strange glow which is emanating from her stomach and shining through the shower curtain.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (to Carol) Yeah. It's okay, honey. I'm okay. But she continues to stare at the frightening glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting in the waiting room. A NURSE calls her name. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Mrs. Spofford? Alex goes to the Nurse.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: (continuing) Positive.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Seven, eight weeks.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Do you have a doctor? We can recommend somebody.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What? Uh, no. Thanks. Yeah. I have a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is playing the piano. Then he shifts from whatever he is playing into Brahms' lullaby. He sings along.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: (singing) Lullabye and good night -- la da da da da di-di-di...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is asleep in bed. Very quiet. Very peaceful. And then a faint sound like a RUSTLE. A soft movement in the room. Jane stirs in her sleep; but she doesn't awaken. CAMERA PANS SLOWLY DOWN TO the bottom of the bed. The RUSTLING sound continues. And then a snake appears winding its way up the bedpost. It slithers onto the bed. Jane's feet move under the covers. The SNAKE HISSES in reaction to the movement.

dialogues.speaker: FOOT OF BED 292
dialogues.text: where a second and third snake slither up the bedpost and make their way onto the bed.

dialogues.speaker: JANE 293
dialogues.text: who is beginning to wake up. She kicks with her feet, pushing the covers off her body.

dialogues.speaker: JANE'S BARE LEGS 294
dialogues.text: as a snake slides across them.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX'S SLEEPING FACE.
dialogues.text: Alex wakes with a start. She sits up. She is shaking.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Jane? cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wakes up. She senses that something is wrong. She listens. The room is filled with the sound of RUSTLING MOVEMENT. She reaches for the bedside lamp. She turns it on to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: SNAKE 298
dialogues.text: on the bedside table HISSING at her with open mouth.

dialogues.speaker: JANE 299
dialogues.text: who screams and pushes the table away from her. The table falls over, the lamp topples to the floor to reveal...  300 301 302 303 304 305 306 307 308 95.

dialogues.speaker: ROOM 300
dialogues.text: The light from the lamp spills across the floor which is covered with snakes. Jane looks around the room in horror.

dialogues.speaker: PANNING ROOM 301
dialogues.text: which is filled with snakes.

dialogues.speaker: JANE 302
dialogues.text: who sees the snakes on the foot of the bed. She presses herself against the headboard of the bed, pulling her knees up against her chest. But there is no escape. From over the headboard, two more snakes slide down just past her ears and onto her shoulders. Jane freezes in horror. The bed slowly fills up with snakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex's car pulls up in front of the house. Alex gets out of the car and looks at the house. Then she hears a SCREAM. She runs toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bed is now a mound of writhing snakes. Jane is totally covered by them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breaks a window on the front door, unlocks the door and goes into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moves quickly THROUGH the house to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comes into the room and stops.

dialogues.speaker: ROOM 308
dialogues.text: There are no snakes now. The bedside lamp lies on the floor next to the overturned night table. And finally, Jane is sitting on the edge of the bed trembling in shock and fear. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The same glow is emanating from her stomach as with Alex.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: What is happening to me? What is happening?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX 309
dialogues.text: As she goes to Jane and wraps her arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is clearing the table. She looks pale and weak and very hot and feverish. She carries some dishes to the sink and starts washing them. Over this we hear on the radio..

dialogues.speaker: RADIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... Record low temperatures are expected again in eastern Rhode Island. Subfreezing conditions have brought the death toll among elderly citizens to sixty-three in the last fifteen days... Sukie wipes sweat from her face and neck. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is lying under three sunlamps wearing a bathing suit and sunglasses. His body is oiled and glistening. A large bowl of various tropical fruit is within reach as well as an iced bottle of champagne. On his RADIO, we hear the continuation of the report...

dialogues.speaker: RADIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... And no letup is in sight. The stationary cold front is expected to continue, with highs in the low teens and lows nearing twenty below. Daryl switches the radio to a MUSIC station. Then he take a pomegranate from the bowl of fruit. He picks up a knife. He pokes at the pomegranate, making small inci- sions in the skin. cut TO:  312 313 314 315 316 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is at the sink, still washing dishes. Suddenly, she feels a cramp in her stomach -- a short sharp pain. Then another. She almost doubles over as the pains keep coming. Then they pass. She goes to the kitchen table and sits down. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is still lying under the sunlamps. With his thumbs, he pulls open the pomegranate, revealing the tiny berries inside. He bites into the berries. The red juice squirts over his mouth and chin. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is still sitting at the kitchen table, wondering what is wrong with her. She is holding her stomach. Then she takes one hand and wipes more sweat from her forehead. Her hand leaves a trail of red on her forehead. She doesn't see it. But she does notice her hand. It, too, has red on it. Then she looks down at her lap. What she sees shocks her. Slowly, she stands up and we see that the front of her dress is stained with red blood. It is still wet.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Oh, God... Oh, God... She stands where she is as blood continues to flow from her groin, spreading through her dress, running down her legs and dripping onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: are sitting with Sukie's children in a small lounge area.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR 316
dialogues.text: approaching. He stops when he reaches the lounge area.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Can we talk?  98.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, JANE AND DOCTOR 317
dialogues.text: moving out of earshot of the children.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: She's still hemorrhaging. We've slowed it down, but...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Is she going to be all right?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: If we can figure out what the hell it is, I think we have a chance. Whatever it is, I'm not sure we can save the baby.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: She's pregnant?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. Couple of months. Jane and Alex look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Can we see her?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: She's still in a lot of pain. I can't give her anything too strong until we know what we're dealing with. But, yeah. Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is lying in bed. She is extremely weak and obviously in great pain.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX AND JANE 319
dialogues.text: coming into the room.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Sukie? Hi.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE 320
dialogues.text: Seeing Alex and Jane, moved to tears.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: You came. I wanted you to come. I wanted to call you, but I was afraid.  99.

dialogues.speaker: THREE OF THEM 321
dialogues.text: As Alex and Jane move close to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Of course we came.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Are we still friends? You're not mad at me, are you?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Come on, don't be dumb.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: I want us all to be together again. I want everything to be the way it was.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You're going to be fine. We just talked to the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Poor guy. He doesn't know what's going on. Does he?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Sure, he does.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: It's him. It's Daryl. Isn't it? Jane looks at Alex. Then...

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: (continuing) Boy, I remember breaking up with guys when I was dating. But this is amazing.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's a little out of control.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Felicia was right, wasn't she?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think so.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: And we wished for him. Didn't we? We brought him here. We did it. She is gripped by a sudden pain. She gasps. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Okay, baby. Take it easy. But the pain continues. And then, slowly, a kind of soft light begins to emanate from Sukie's stomach. The sheet begins to glow. On top of being in pain, Sukie is now terrified. Alex and Jane hold onto her. The intensity of the light increases until the sheet is almost transparent.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Make him stop, Alex. Please. Make him stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Alex's CAR races up the drive and SCREECHES to a halt. Alex gets out and marches up to the front door. She doesn't knock. She pushes open the door and walks boldly, deliberately into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: coming through the door.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Daryl!

dialogues.speaker: FIDEL 324
dialogues.text: approaching Alex.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is ironing clothes. He has an ironing board set up in front of the fire. Next to his feet is a basket full of clothes. In front of him, is a small portable TELEVISION, on which an episode of "Dallas" is PLAYING.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX 327
dialogues.text: barging into the room. She stops, surprised by the sight of Daryl and the ironing board.  101.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Alex, honey. What a nice surprise. How are you? He continues ironing and watching the TV.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Daryl?

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Oh, just catching up with a little housework. I was sending the shirts out, but, Jesus, they were coming back in pieces. Small town. Not enough Orientals. And Fidel is all thumbs with this kind of thing, so -- that leaves little ol' me...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I'm not talking about your laundry, Daryl. I'm talking about Sukie. And Jane. And me.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Golly, you girls are just having the worst time, aren't you? Alex switches OFF the TV.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Sukie is very sick, Daryl.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well, I'm sorry to hear that.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Are you?

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Of course, I am.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Then do something about it.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Me? What can I do about it? I mean, it doesn't really have anything to do with me anymore. Does it?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yes, it does. You know it does. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: No, I don't. All I know is that one day we were friends and the next day, I was shut out. That's all I know. One day I was the answer to your prayers and five minutes later, nobody would give me the time of day.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Daryl, you have to stop this.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Stop? Stop what?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Sukie could die. Don't you understand that?

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: I can't help that.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yes, you can. Don't lie to me!

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: You deserted me! We had a deal and you walked out on it...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That's no reason...

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Yes, it is! You pissed me off. What was I supposed to do? Take it like a man?! Christ, I gave you everything I got. I gave you more than anybody's ever given you. And what do I get? A little ‘thank you'? A little gratitude? I'11l tell you what I get. I get screwed.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What do you want from us, Daryl? Just tell me what you want. Daryl explodes, throwing the ironing board across the room.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: I want somebody to do these shirts! That's what I want! (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DARYL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want a little attention. I want a little respect. I want somebody to take care of me for a change. How about that? Huh?! ‘What do I want?' What does any man want? A little affection. A little trust. God damn it, everything I did, I did for you. He calms down. Then sort of sadly... Alex goes

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: (continuing) Well, my mistake. Go on. Go on back to your miserable little lives. Goon. If that's what you want, that's what you get. Fuck me, if I care. You're not the only three women in the world. to him. She takes his hand. Then gently...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You're hurting people, Daryl. It's not right. All the things you did for us, all those things you gave us, they are good. But you can't use them to hurt people. Don't you see that? Don't you understand that?

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: No. I just want my family back together again. That's all. You and Jane and Sukie. I wouldn't hurt Sukie. I wouldn't hurt any of you. How could I do that? I love you.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (with sympathy) No. You don't know what love is. Do you?

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: I could learn. Couldn't I? You could teach me. How hard could it be?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Daryl... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: And I could still teach you a few things. We're a good team, the four of us. We could do anything. You have no idea. That's the thing about women. They have so much power, but they just don't know how to use it. I could show you things...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah, I bet you could.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: How about a kiss? Come on. What do you say? Alex doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What are we going to do with you?

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: There's nothing you can do. You're stuck with me. Oh, Alex, let's not fight. There's no way you can win. There just isn't. And there's nothing to go back to even if you could win. Come on. Can't we put all this behind us and be friends again? Hmn? He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: (continuing) There, isn't that nice? Be honest, now. Haven't you missed me? Just a little bit?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah. I have.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Come on. Let's kiss and make it all better. Hmn? What do you say? 104. 328 Alex looks at him a long time. Then she takes him into her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 329 Sukie is in the hospital bed. Jane is almost asleep in a chair. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sukie sits up suddenly in the bed. She feels her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Jane? Jane?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Yeah, honey. What?

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: It's stopped. The pain. It stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: showing the end of winter -- snow melting, the sun shin- ing warmly, ice cracking on a lake, etc. LEGEND ON THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: driving through town. Over the above, we hear...

dialogues.speaker: RADIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... Marking the end of one of the longest cold spells on record. Temperatures are pushing up well into the forties as each day brings us closer to a long awaited and long overdue spring...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: switches OFF the car RADIO. Then he adjusts the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: MIRROR 333
dialogues.text: in which we can see the three faces of Sukie, Alex, and Jane. And then the faces of the children. The women are calm, almost serene. They are not speaking. Over this we hear Daryl playing the PIANO and singing a slow, sensuous version of...

dialogues.speaker: DARYL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (singing) ‘I can't give you anything but love, baby. That's the only thing I've plenty of, baby...'  334 335 336 337 338 339 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the limo pulls up to the front door. Fidel gets out, comes around and opens the door for the passengers. The singing continues...

dialogues.speaker: DARYL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: --. Dream a while Scheme a while You're sure to find Happiness and I guess All those things you've always pined for...'

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, SUKIE AND JANE AND CHILDREN 335
dialogues.text: Getting out of the car. They look beautiful. They are wearing black evening dresses, jewelry, and furs. Their hair is perfect, their makeup is just right. Each in her own way is breathtaking. They hover for a few seconds near the car. Alex brushes a loose strand of Sukie's hair back into place. They look at each other. They smile. Then they move toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire is blazing in the fireplace. Candles have been lighted. MUSIC CONTINUES. Elegance is in the air.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL 337
dialogues.text: dressed in black tie, at the piano, playing and singing.

dialogues.speaker: CHILDREN AND WOMEN 338
dialogues.text: Listening. A family portrait. One by one, the women move into...

dialogues.speaker: THREE WOMEN AND DARYL 339
dialogues.text: draped around the piano, sipping champagne, listening with love in their eyes. Slowly, one by one, they move closer to him, caressing him, kissing him lightly, and joining him in the song...

dialogues.speaker: ALL OF THEM
dialogues.text: (singing) ‘Gee, I'd like to see you looking swell, baby (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ALL OF THEM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (singing) Diamond bracelets Woolworth doesn't sell, baby ‘Till that happy day, you know darn well, baby I can't give you anything but love.' Daryl stops playing. He raises his glass and offers a toast.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: To the future. Our future. They all lift their glasses.

dialogues.speaker: GLASSES, (SLOW MOTION)
dialogues.text: As they move toward each other. Electricity dances between them as they move closer and closer. A RUMBLING, THUNDER-LIKE sound vibrates the air. Finally, the GLASSES CLINK together and SHATTER, shards of glass flying in SLOW MOTION through the air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fidel is waiting with the Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL 342
dialogues.text: Coming out of the house, feeling mellow and completely satiated and looking like the cat that swallowed three canaries. Fidel opens the car door for him.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: We're going to town, Fidel. The girls have a craving for bagels and ice cream. Before he gets into the car, he looks up at...

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS WINDOW 343
dialogues.text: At which the three women are waving to him and smiling.  344 345 346 347 348 349 350 108.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: I'll be right back. He blows them three kisses and hops into the car. Fidel closes the door, gets into the driver's seat and the car pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: WINDOW
dialogues.text: The three women stop waving. Their smiles fade. They watch as the car pulls away. They look at each other. And then they disappear from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is banging through the cupboards until she finds a medium-size saucepan. Then she takes some butter from the refrigerator and covers the inside of the sauce pan with it. She is moving fast, frantically. She drops the pan. She tries to calm herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is looking through the clothes in Daryl's closet. She too, is full of nervous energy. She sees a laundry bag. She rummages through the dirty clothes until she finds a dirty sock and a dirty pair of jockey shorts. Then she grabs the pillow from Daryl's bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: picks up Daryl's razor, removes the blade and then, with a tissue, she collects from the blade all the tiny hairs left from the last time he shaved. Her hands are shaking.

dialogues.speaker: WASTE CAN
dialogues.text: As Jane dumps it on the floor. She picks through the debris and selects a used piece of dental floss and a couple of sheets of toilet paper that have little blood stains on them from shaving nicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: puts the buttered saucepan on the stove and lights the fire under it. Then she takes some candles of various kinds and sizes -- including a box of blue and pink birthday candles -- and chops them into pieces with a large butcher knife. Then she dumps the pieces into the saucepan. 344 345 346 347 348 349 350  351 352 353 354 355 109.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE AND JANE 351
dialogues.text: Putting everything they collected into a frying pan, in- cluding some feathers from the pillow.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Do you know what you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: No. They squirt charcoal-barbecue lighter over everything; then they set fire to it. It scares the hell out of them.

dialogues.speaker: THREE WOMEN
dialogues.text: Stirring the ashes from the burnt contents of the frying pan into the melted wax in the saucepan. Alex stirs it with a metal whisk.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It smells.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: This is really disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: This is really stupid.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX 353
dialogues.text: Pouring the mixture of melted wax and ashes into a pate mold.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: holds the mold under the faucet and runs cold water over the back of it. Then she taps the sides of the mold until the now-cooler wax plops out into Alex's waiting hands. Alex quickly shapes the wax into an oblong. She is ready to go to work.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Okay. Get me a knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black Mercedes is parked in front of a deli. People are going in and out carrying various packages and copies of the Sunday New York Times.  356 357 358

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is waiting in a crowd for his turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: comes out Daryl wal bagels. INT. LENO. Carving t assist. waist and The crumb: During th

dialogues.speaker: MAN BEHIND THE COUNTER
dialogues.text: Ninety-seven. Ninety-seven is next.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Here. That's me.

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (BEHIND THE COUNTER)
dialogues.text: What'1l it be?

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: A dozen bagels, half pound of gravlax and what kind of ice cream do you have?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: No ice cream. Freezer is broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and gives his packages to Fidel.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: No ice cream. I'm going to see if I can find some. You wait here. ks off down the street, munching on one of the

dialogues.speaker: X HOUSE
dialogues.text: he wax into a doll as Jane and Sukie watch and Using a small paring knife, she carves out a a neck. And then a head and legs and arms. s fall onto a paper towel under the doll. e@ above...

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: He's kind of cute. Isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Oh, come on. Who are you kidding? It doesn't even look like him.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I don't think it really has to look like him. I mean, we know who it is. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: We should have saved a little hair. For his head. He looks funny with no hair.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Poor baby. When she is finished carving, Alex gathers the crumbs onto the edge of the knife. Sukie holds a match to them. As they melt, Alex lets them drip onto the groin of the doll, forming a penis. A LOUD CLANG of CHURCH BELLS is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is making his way cheerfully through town. In the back- ground, we can see people entering the church for Sunday services. CHURCH BELLS continue to RING fiercely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex reads from a very old book.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Auraii, Hanlii, Thameii, Tilinos, Athamus, Zianor, Auounail. She passes the book to Sukie. Daryl's DOG starts to GROWL.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Tzabaoth, Messiach,, Emanuel, Elohim, Eibor, Yod, He, Vou, He.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: ‘He Vou He'?

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: That's what it says. Here. Your turn. Sukie passes the book to Jane.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Oh, Alex, I don't know. Could you leave me out of this? I think I'm getting a migrane. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No. It has to be all three of us. It was the three of us that brought him here.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: But it's not fair. Couldn't we just talk to him?

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Jane...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. (she reads) Astachoth, Adonai, Agla, On, El, Tetragrammaton... and I hope it doesn't work. The DOG starts to BARK FURIOUSLY. The women jump.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What's the matter with him?

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: (to the dog) Come on, baby. Come on. Outside. She puts the dog out.

dialogues.speaker: THREE WOMEN 361
dialogues.text: Each takes a pin and aims it at the doll -- one at the legs, one at an arm, one at the head.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: All at once? Or one at a time?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (looking at the book) It doesn't say.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Oh, for God's sake. Here. She jabs the doll's right leg.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Penetration. Sukie giggles and jabs the arm. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Now hold it. Alex jabs the head of the doll with the pin. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is making his choice.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: ... Yeah and some pistachio. Is that pistachio?

dialogues.speaker: COUNTERMAN
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Great. And some chocolate chocolate chip and... Ahhh! He yelps in pain and grabs his leg.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: (continuing) What the hell...?!

dialogues.speaker: COUNTERMAN
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: No! My leg is... Ahhh! Another pain -- this time in his arm.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: (continuing) Jesus Christ. What is that?! And finally, an excruciating pain in his head. Daryl yelps and falls to the floor, writhing in agony. The Man comes from behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTERMAN
dialogues.text: Hey, what's the matter? Daryl can't answer. And then the pain subsides. Daryl is gasping for breath.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTERMAN
dialogues.text: (continuing) Are you having a heart attack? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: I'm okay, I'm okay. He struggles to his feet. He is very shaky. He starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTERMAN
dialogues.text: You want your ice cream? Here's your ice cream. He gives Daryl the ice cream. Daryl pushes some money at him.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Yeah. Thanks. As he leaves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still holding the pins which are stuck in the doll.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Suppose somebody finds us like this. What do we say? They laugh and let go of the pins.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: So? What now?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I don't know. Why do you keep asking me? I don't know, I'm just guessing. They sit and look at the doll.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: It's sad. You know?

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. It is.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I mean, why don't these things ever work out?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I don't know that either. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She takes a grape from a bowl of fruit and eats it. Sukie drops some of the goose feathers from Daryl's pillow onto the doll.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Look. We can use these feathers for his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is limping slightly and holding his head as he makes his way down the street. Then he gags. Something is in his mouth. He chokes and spits and, as he does, the feathers start to come out of his mouth. He looks at the feathers and realizes what is happening.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Oh, girls. Girls. What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giggling as Sukie drops more feathers onto the doll.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL AND OTHER KIDS 367
dialogues.text: Coming into the kitchen, screaming and laughing and asking for breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. Breakfast. Let's clean up this mess. That's enough, Sukie. Come on. Cut it out. Alex leans over and blows the feathers off the doll. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is still spitting feathers when a fierce wind suddenly blows up around him. Daryl is knocked to the ground. He struggles to stand up. But the wind is of hurricane force and it literally blows him down the street. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: People scatter and run for cover as trees fall and cars are overturned, but the wind is focused on Daryl as he stumbles, trips, falls and rolls -- trying desperately to get to some shelter. Blinded by the whirling dust, he gropes his way toward a building. He feels his way along the side of the building until he finds a door. He opens it and the wind blows him into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daryl is as surprised as we are to see where he is. A service was in progress until the great wind blew through the doors. The congregation and the minister back toward the walls. Daryl turns to face the wind. Summoning up all his strength, he fights his way to the doors and, gathering superhuman power, he pushes them closed. The WIND POUNDS at the building, but for the moment, Daryl has escaped it. He catches his breath. He is bruised badly, his clothing is torn and shredded and he is still hurting from the pain of the pins. Finally, he takes in the terrified congregation. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Sorry... uh... having a little trouble... having a little trouble at home. A little domestic situation. No need to be alarmed. A little female trouble, that's all. Hi. How are you? He laughs as he moves unsteadily up the aisle. The congregation continues to move away from him. The minister steers people toward the back of the church.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: (continuing) Women. Ha. Can't live with them, can't live without them. He doubles over suddenly, gags, opens his mouth and a stream of grapes comes out of it. The congregation is amazed. Daryl recovers...

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: (continuing) Pay no attention. Pay no attention. Cheap trick. Anybody can do it. I taught it to them. Ungrateful little bitches, aren't they? Let me ask you something. You're all churchgoing folk. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DARYL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let me ask you -- do you think God knew what he was doing when he created women? Huh? No shit, I want to know. Do you think he knew or do you think it was another of his little mistakes? Like earthquakes, and floods. Volcanos. Tidal waves. Just another little fuck-up in the divine plan. Like cancer. Do you think women are like that? He gags and spits out more feathers and grapes. The WIND ROARS outside the church. Daryl is having a harder time recovering from these fits and attacks.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: (continuing) What's the matter? You don't think God makes mistakes? Sure he does. We all make mistakes. ‘Course, we make mistakes and they call it evil. God makes mistakes and they call it nature. So what do you think? Women. A mistake? Or did he do it to us on purpose? I'd like to know. Because if it's a mistake, maybe we could do something about it. Find a cure. A vaccine. Build up the immune system. Eat broccoli. Geta little exercise. Maybe that's all it would take. Twenty pushups a day and you'll never be afflicted with women again. An excruciating pain pierces his brain. He grabs his head, falls to his knees. While he's down, the congrega- tion moves toward the doors and opens them. The wind rushes in. The people fight their way out of the church. Daryl starts banging his head against the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is being banged on the table by one of the kids (Bobby).

dialogues.speaker: SCENE 371
dialogues.text: As everyone starts preparing breakfast. Sukie takes the doll away from Bobby. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Bobby, don't play with that. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You're not taking this seriously.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I'm hungry. I don't concentrate when I'm hungry. They continue setting the table. Sukie gives Alex the doll.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, Alex. Honest. I don't think we are really evolved enough for this. Alex wraps the doll up in some tin foil.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well, you have to believe. That's all. In yourself. In what you are doing. Do we want eggs or french toast? What's the vote? She tosses the doll onto the counter. As it rolls along the counter... cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is rolling down the aisle of the church. He stops. He stands up. He looks like he has been in a street brawl. He waits to see if something else is going to happen. Nothing. He gathers his strength and walks out of the church. He is not happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: comes outside as Fidel pulls up with the car. Daryl gets in and the car pulls away through the debris and the chaos left from the hurricane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breakfast is still being prepared.  375 376 377 378 379 119.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY 375
dialogues.text: As he reaches for the tin foil-wrapped doll. He fiddles with it, poking his finger into the doll's stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reacts to Bobby's poke in the stomach.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Let's get a move on, Fidel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: puts the doll into a toaster over. He closes the door. He is about to push the start button, when...

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Bobby, get away from there. Come and sit down. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE 378
dialogues.text: As everyone sits down to breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well, I guess we are stuck with him then.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Well, really, you know, when you think about it, he has his good points.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Nobody's perfect.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Carol, say grace.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Bless us, oh Lord, and these Thy gifts which we are about to receive...

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN DOOR 379
dialogues.text: bursts open. Daryl comes in.  120.

dialogues.speaker: WOMEN 380
dialogues.text: Shocked by the sudden appearance and by his appearance, too. He looks like he has been run over by a truck.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Daryl...

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Daryl! What happened? Daryl limps toward the table, holding his head. Jane grabs his arm to help him, but he yelps in pain and pushes her away.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Have a bagel. (he drops them on the table) The ice cream melted.

dialogues.speaker: WOMEN 381
dialogues.text: Realizing the doll magic has worked. They are horrified.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Alex...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Oh, Daryl. They rush to help him into a chair.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: This isn't nice, girls. This isn't nice. Are you really this mad? Huh? Are you?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Oh, honey, no.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Here, let me clean your face. Alex wets a cloth at the sink and wipes his brow.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: What did I do? Huh? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: (to the kids) Come on, kids, get out of here now. Daryl's not feeling good. The kids leave the room.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: I didn't make the world. I'm just trying to survive it.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Do you want some coffee? I'll get you some coffee.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: You got to be a little tough. Dog eat dog, man eat man -- that's the way it is. That's God's plan. Not mine. The women are running around trying to do everything for him.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Daryl, I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Do you want a bagel?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Here's your coffee, honey. Oh, God. Maybe we should calla doctor...

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Here's your bagel.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Could you toast it for me, Sukie?

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Sure. Sukie takes the bagel to the toaster oven, throws it inside, closes the door without noticing the doll is inside, and pushes the start button.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We didn't mean to hurt you. Honest. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Sure. I know that. But that's what it comes down to, doesn't it? He starts to feel warm, uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: (continuing) We hurt each other to survive. We kill each other to survive. That's God's plan. No purpose. No grace. No beauty. He begins to twitch and transform, a growing darkness coming over him.

dialogues.speaker: FOIL-WRAPPED DOLL 382
dialogues.text: In the toaster over, as Daryl speaks.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: It's a terrible creation, this world. An unholy war of nature. Life against life. A parasitic cellular conflagration. Daryl's body begins to do peculiar things -- jerking, changing shapes, as if an internal force were trying to burst through his skin.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: (continuing) You think goodness and beauty and kindness... You think that's the way to survive? All right. Let's try it.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Daryl! What is happening to you? The women back away from him. A whirlwind surrounds Daryl. Starts to levitate.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: What do you say? Let's rise above nature. Huh? I am willing to compromise. Men and women. There must be a better way. What do you say we try to find it? You and me. Screw God. And nature. And all of nature's violence... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
