dialogues.text: Daryl is in the midst of a violent transformation that contradicts everything he is saying. We are now seeing a vision of real evil emerge from him.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: (continuing) --. We don't have to hurt each other like this. Do we? (starts to sing) ‘I can't give you anything but love, baby.' Jane starts to go to him. Alex stops her.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Oh, Alex...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Jane, don't.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Poor baby.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Don't listen!

dialogues.speaker: TOASTER OVEN 383
dialogues.text: EXPLODES suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: WOMEN 384
dialogues.text: Dive to the floor. A strange SCREAMING sound is heard and then silence. The whirlwind stops. The women get up from the floor. The kitchen is a shambles, but more important, Daryl is gone. The three women look at each other. Then slowly they embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explodes from the earth -- trees bud, leaves appear, flowers shoot up from the ground, grow tall, bud and blossom, entire fields turn bright green, forests bloom, etc.  386 387 388 389 390 391 392 393 394 395 124.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking bright, freshly painted and cheerful. The Gothic feeling has been transformed into a kind of colorful Victorian gingerbread motif. CELLO MUSIC CONTINUES.

dialogues.speaker: GROUNDS
dialogues.text: are covered with masses of flowers.

dialogues.speaker: TERRACE
dialogues.text: Where Jane is playing her cello.

dialogues.speaker: JANE'S BABY BOY
dialogues.text: crawling happily across the terrace toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: LAWN
dialogues.text: where Sukie is seated at a table under an umbrella. She is typing what looks like a 4,000 page manuscript.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE'S CHILDREN
dialogues.text: playing on the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: ANLGE
dialogues.text: crawling across the lawn away from Sukie, toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PART OF GROUNDS
dialogues.text: where Alex is working at sculpting a huge twenty-foot piece of marble. Carol is sunbathing nearby.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX'S NEW BABY BOY
dialogues.text: is crawling away from Alex across the lawn, toward the house with the other two babies. Is it our imagination or do they really seem to be communicating to each other?

dialogues.speaker: FIDEL
dialogues.text: coming from the house, wheeling a cart which has on it a pitcher, a bottle of vodka, dry vermouth, olives and martini glasses. 386 387 388 389 390 391 392 393 394 395  396

dialogues.speaker: THREE WOMEN
dialogues.text: together now, mixing martinis. They are very comfortable and at peace with the world. They talk casually.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I hear Raymond Neff is on the prowl again.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: (laughs) Oh, no. Really?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: His wife phoned me this morning. She was in tears. Apparently he's been chasing that new waitress at the coffee shop.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: They never learn, do they?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I said we'd see what we can do. They drink their drinks. Alex looks at Jane, her thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Jane. Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Just stop it.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: You stop it. Stop reading my mind. I can think about him if I want to.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Not when the three of us are together.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: All right. But I can't help it. I miss him.

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Jane...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I do. And you do, too. Admit it. reading 125. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SUKIE
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Okay. I admit it. But do you want him back? No answer.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (continuing) Do you? Still no answer. They remain, lost in the question.

dialogues.speaker: FIDEL 397
dialogues.text: is wheeling the drinks cart back into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wheels the cart through the house toward the kitchen. The interior of the house is also transformed -- full of light and white-colored furnishings. Fidel moves OUT OF FRAME. CAMERA MOVES THROUGH the living room TOWARD the doors of the bedroom which are open slightly. MUFFLED SOUNDS can be heard. CAMERA MOVES SLOWLY, SLOWLY THROUGH the doors and INTO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on which a Bugs Bunny cartoon is playing. PULL BACK SLOWLY to reveal: the three baby boys sitting in front of the screens. They are playing with the remote con- trol unit. Or are they just playing? Once again it seems like they are communicating. CUTTING BACK AND FORTH BETWEEN the babies and the video screens as the cartoon is replaced on each screen by another image. The babies look like they know what they're doing. As the puzzle comes together on the screens, we recognize the smiling face of Daryl Van Horne.

dialogues.speaker: BABIES 400
dialogues.text: SCREAM with delight.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Shhh. Take it easy. That's it. We don't want the whole household in here, do we?  402 403 404 127.

dialogues.speaker: BABIES 402
dialogues.text: calm down.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: That's it. Good boys. Yes. We're going to do just fine. Aren't we? Coochi-coochi-coo. (he laughs) Now, come to Daddy. Come on. Come to Daddy and give hima big kiss...

dialogues.speaker: BABIES 403
dialogues.text: as they start to crawl toward the screens.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL'S FACE 404
dialogues.text: filling the wall of screens. CAMERA MOVES IN CLOSER and CLOSER.

dialogues.speaker: DARYL
dialogues.text: Yes. Come on. Come on. Come to Daddy. Come on. Daryl laughs. FREEZE FRAME. FADE OUT.
